The volume of a pyramid whose base is an equilateral triangle of side length 6 and whose other edges are each of length $ \sqrt{15}$ is\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 9 \qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 9/2 \qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 27/2 \qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ \frac{9\sqrt3}{2} \qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ \text{none of these}$
